identified-content.person: SNYDER, DR. LAURA JOY (DR. LAURA JOY GIORGINI)

block.p: Dr. Laura Joy Snyder and Dr. Giovanni Giorgini, both professors, are to be married today by Rabbi Michael Feinberg at the Hudson River Club in Manhattan.

The bride, 35, is an assistant professor of philosophy at St. John's University in Jamaica, Queens. She graduated magna cum laude from Brandeis University and received a master's degree and a Ph.D. in philosophy from Johns Hopkins University. The bride is keeping her name. She is a daughter of Irene Snyder of Syosset, N.Y., and Fred Snyder of Pompano Beach, Fla., and a stepdaughter of Flori Snyder. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

She is a daughter of Irene Snyder of Syosset, N.Y., and Fred Snyder of Pompano Beach, Fla., and a stepdaughter of Flori Snyder. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

The bridegroom, 41, is an associate professor of the history of political thought at the University of Bologna in Italy, from which he graduated summa cum laude. He received a Ph.D. in political science from the University of Turin. He is a son of Albertina Giordani of Bologna and the late Gino V. Giorgini.

The couple met last year, when they were visiting fellows at Clare Hall of Cambridge University in England. The bride, whose academic specialty is the history and philosophy of science, was on a Fulbright scholarship, researching a book on 19th-century British philosophy of science. The bridegroom, who specializes in political philosophy, was an Italian National Council for Research fellow, completing a book on contemporary British and American political thought.
